newsitem.title: FRANCE: Rhone-Poulenc Pasteur unit sees higher 1996 sales.
newsitem.headline: Rhone-Poulenc Pasteur unit sees higher 1996 sales.

text.p: Pasteur Merieux Connaught, the Rhone-Poulenc unit which combines the former separate units Pasteur Merieux Connaught and Pasteur Merieux MSD, said it expected 1996 sales of 6.4 billion francs.

This would be a 12 percent increase from 1995 at constant exchange rates. The company said in a statement that its sales in Europe would be up by 11 percent, in north America by 14 percent and international sales also by 14 percent.
Pasteur Merieux Connaught is specialising in vaccines and aims to develop new vaccines for bacterial infections and viral infections.
It said it would focus in particular on infections affecting childrens' respiratory systems.
The company also aims to have a number of possible AIDS vaccines ready for testing from 1998.
